title: Project Director- Riyadh
content:
Our Vision:
 
Our vision is to inspire brands and people to impact the world. To create big ideas that make a significant contribution to the planet, society, and the bottom line. We believe in today’s world this is the best way for our clients to achieve sustainable growth.   
 
We achieve this by breaking down the barriers that restrict talent and ideas, we call this Borderless Creativity.        
 
Which is why our teams work fluidly across 5 capabilities Advertising, Experience, PR, Consulting and Health .   This allows us to not only operate but innovate at the intersection of capabilities and talent.  We believe impact and magic lies at this intersection.   Ogilvy scales this by seamlessly connecting and accessing the deep cultural expertise of 132 offices in 83 countries.   
 
Our mission: We inspire brands and people to impact the world
How we do it : We innovate and operate at the intersection of people and capabilities
What we do: Borderless creativity
 
Today, Ogilvy is recognized as the world’s leading creative agency. We are also one of the most effective networks globally.
 
 
About Memac Ogilvy:
 
Memac Ogilvy is one of the leading creative networks in MENA with its flagship office in the UAE and a strong local footprint in the GCC and North Africa. It is part of the formidable worldwide WPP & Ogilvy network. It’s the only truly integrated comms network – with Consulting, Advertising- Brand & Content, PR, Experience & Health under 1 P&L and under single leadership. Memac Ogilvy is the most integrated modern creative and effective partner for client growth in MENA. We inspire brands and people to impact the world. We deliver on this by combining expert and new capabilities for modern marketing solutions, with solid project management expertise for agile and effective delivery as well as a thorough and passionate People agenda.
The agency is the most awarded Middle Eastern agency in Cannes as well as a big winner at the local award show Lynx. It counts around 500 staff members.
 
What we're looking for:
We are looking for a Project Director to lead an embedded team at a prominent governmental entity in Riyadh.
Your role is the most senior position within the embedded this team, with significant responsibility. As an expert in your field, we expect to make the most of your specific disciplined skill set in addition to your experience leading a large group of talented individuals.
As the Director on one of OGILVY’s key Riyadh accounts, you are responsible for the delivery of the contract, and the growth of both the client and OGILVY staff. You will position yourself as a trusted advisor to key persons of influence on client and agency side, and take a central role in organizing workflow, managing key meetings, and delivering critical documents.
Key focus areas include project management, team cadence, reinforcing accountability across both OGILVY and client teams, analyzing, and solving operational challenges, issue management and resolution, crisis communications coordination across multiple dispersed teams, growth of people and culture, resource planning and management, and client/team leadership. 
Importantly, you will have a positive engaged approach to supporting and upskilling others in operations and project delivery skills. You will invest time in recruitment, coaching and training, and the culture of the team(s) you lead, and the wider agency.
 
 
To Succeed in This Role, You Need To:

Project management and execution of strategic project for client, consisting of six several work streams.
Management of OGILVY resource, on the ground and remote, including holidays, hours, days in lieu, deployment schedules, skills gaps and training needs.
Day to day management of Media Center/Corporate Communications on behalf of client, inclusive of:
Assessing requests and taking briefs.
Assigning appropriate resource to delivery.
Reinforcing accountability and discipline of both Green Riyadh and OGILVY teams.
Reviewing materials for quality.
Escalating challenges to senior team where required.
Client relationship management and issue resolution.
Ongoing process improvement leadership and initiatives.
Provide extensive support to other Directors across contract, including:
Strategic planning and execution.
Co-designing solutions to business problems.
Implementing senior direction across client management, OGILVY team management, and deliverables.

CONSULTING:

Able to lead complex projects for both OGILVY and clients, managing deliverables, timelines, scope, risk, and budgets.
Provides strategic input and oversight to development of key deliverables. 
Act as lead crisis communications coordinator and leverage skills of OGILVY teams during high-pressure crisis contexts.
Possess solid presentation skills, including ability to communicate and sell ideas to prospects and current clients at a C-suite or Ministerial level.
Develop and deliver presentations with clear narratives for VVIPs, utilizing pyramid principle and best-in-practice design/formatting!
Confident when engaging in challenging conversations with the client, providing guidance on what is feasible and practical with finite resource.
Ability to brief and project manage a team in the delivery of a wide program of activity.
Confident and disciplined when working with third party agencies across the marketing mix.

PEOPLE:

Demonstrate agile leadership to balance the demands of the client with the demands of the team.
Serves as a positive role model by demonstrating a positive attitude, professionalism, and dedication to staff, which encourages teamwork and professionalism throughout the office. 
Knows the resources within office (i.e., HR Manager, IT staff, Financial Manager) and directs staff to appropriate resources to solve problems.
Participates and reviews performance management process when required.
Proactively gives informal constructive feedback to team on a regular and timely basis.
Identifies top performers and assigns client work and projects that will motivate, encourage, and retain them.
Approves/reviews staffing assignments of any direct reports on all applicable accounts.
Manages time effectively, meets deadlines, pays attention to detail and sets priorities.
Conducts fair and objective evaluations to assess the performance of staff.
Act as OGILVY ambassador internally and externally.
Builds valuable relationships with key persons of influence in client organization to help team effectively plan ahead and “see around corners.”

PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT:

Exemplify the company’s ethics, vision and values in daily work.
Build on your emotional intelligence and self-awareness.
Take a lead role on operational leadership across OGILVY, providing internal consulting services to senior colleagues.
Be seen as a leader within your office/team; display gravitas; manage difficult, complex client relationships.
Successfully manage employee issues and difficult employee communications to a productive outcome.
Complete regular internal and external training and professional development courses including but not limited to:
Octave/First Chair/progress to Maestro.
OGILVY Way (ALL levels).
Advanced negotiation skills.

 
What you will bring:
You are an individual with character, courage and charisma.  A Director with the highest standards of personal ethics, the emotional intelligence to work collaboratively both within and outside Ogilvy and the guts to discern and do what is right, taking the tough decisions and owning them. You bring the energy and flexibility to pitch in and help with whatever needs doing in the office. Given the degree of change we are experiencing and encouraging across our business, you will already have demonstrated a history of managing ongoing and ambitious change at a senior level.
 
Memac Ogilvy inspires brands and people to impact the world. We exist to create iconic, culture-changing, value-driven ideas for our clients. 
Borderless Creativity is our lifeblood. We operate, innovate, and create at the intersection of our talented people, across advertising disciplines such as strategic thinking and distinctive idea creation, through a social-first approach — alongside our wider Memac Ogilvy family of Advertising, Experience, Health, Consulting and PR.  Never have there been more opportunities available to communicate incredible ideas, impact culture, and influence consumer behavior. Paid advertising is a consistent, regular and controllable way of getting a business and brand’s core message in front of consumers in a way that no other medium can. Creativity is our greatest differentiator as we transcend the status quo and shift culture. 
How We’ll Support YouMemac Ogilvy celebrates its people. Fully. Enthusiastically. Unhesitatingly. We’ll empower you with the tools you’ll need to succeed. We’ll give you the autonomy to seek out new paths and better ways of doing things. We’ll support you with colleagues who are experts in their disciplines, drawn from across the Ogilvy network. And we’ll provide opportunities for you to do work of which you’ll be proud, with people you’ll be proud to call your teammates.
 
Ogilvy is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability. We believe in creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion and strives to recruit a diverse slate of candidates to help us achieve that goal.





At Ogilvy, our people are at the heart of what we do: a creative agency that sparks game-changing ideas across culture and business through collaboration, integrity, and a celebration of self-expression. 
We believe in building powerful teams with purpose. This means hiring and nurturing talent across all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientation, and gender identities – and we relentlessly curate transformative initiatives that make our commitment to fairness, and equity a reality. 
Our ultimate mission is to leave a positive impact on the world, creating a better future for all, while supporting and uplifting the global communities we serve.  This is central to our mantra of Borderless Creativity.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.
